columns.name: EQUIPMENT_GROUP_GID
columns.description: The  GID for the equipment group where the axle weight is being defined.  OTM uses equipment status to indicate feasibility. The status type is AXLE_WEIGHT_FEASIBILITY and the statuses are AXLE_WEIGHT_FEASIBILITY_FEASIBLE and AXLE_WEIGHT_FEASIBILITY_INFEASIBLE respectively to indicate feasibility and infeasibility.

columns.name: AXLE_NAME
columns.description: User-specified name for the axle where the distance and max weight are defined, such as front axle or rear axle.

columns.name: AXLE_DISTANCE
columns.description: The distance from the nose of the equipment where the max weight can be loaded.

columns.name: AXLE_DISTANCE_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure qualification (e.g., inches, meters) for the axle distance.

columns.name: AXLE_DISTANCE_BASE
columns.description: Axle distance in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure qualification (e.g., pounds, kilogram ) for the axle maximum weight.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Axle maximum weight in the base weight unit of measure.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Axle distance in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.
